element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm classifies a group of layers into different classes in such a way that the classes are as homogenous as possible. No information about the classes to define is needed to run the algorithm (as it happens with the supervised classification algorithm), since they are automatically defined

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: To balance the weight of the layers, normalizing them using the "0-1" method is recommended. See the associated help file for that algorithm for more information

element.name: INPUT
element.text: bands with variables used for classification

element.name: NUMCLASS
element.text: The number of different classes to create

element.name: RESULTLAYER
element.text: New raster layer with defined classes.

element.name: RESULTTABLE
element.text: The new table contains information about each one of the classes. Each class has an identifier (field "Class") and shows the number of cells occupied by it (field "Count"). Also, a new field is added for each input layer used, containing the mean value of that layer in the class
